intro: Hieracium anobrachion, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. The species is known for its ability to spread via rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
